entry.title: Sockets on OpenShift
entry.summary: In this article, a followup to my previous post regarding long-poll servers and Python, we investigate the code changes that were necessary to make the code work when deployed on OpenShift. In the previous post, we implemented IO polling to watch for client disconnects at the same time we were waiting for messages on a message bus: poll = zmq.Poller() poll.register(subsock, zmq.POLLIN) poll.register(rfile, zmq.POLLIN) events = dict(poll.poll()) . . .
